document_title: Carotid artery stenosis: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content: After surgery or intervention, patients are instructed to re-examine every 1-3 months. Cardiovascular risk factors such as high blood pressure, diabetes, fat metabolism disorders... need to be optimally adjusted to avoid recurrence as well as narrowing of arteries in other locations. Ultrasound check after 3-6 months and every 1-2 years to evaluate results and monitor.
